doc.previous: In 1906 the paper offered 1 000 for the first flight across the English Channel and 10 000 for the first flight from London to Manchester Punch magazine thought the idea preposterous and offered 10 000 for the first flight to Mars but by 1910 both the Mail s prizes had been won For full list see Daily Mail aviation prizes
doc.after: The paper was accused of warmongering before the outbreak of World War I when it reported that Germany was planning to crush the British Empire Northcliffe created controversy by advocating conscription when the war broke out 22 On 21 May 1915 Northcliffe wrote a blistering attack on Lord Kitchener the Secretary of State for War Kitchener was considered a national hero and overnight the paper s circulation dropped from 1 386 000 to 238 000 Fifteen hundred members of the London Stock Exchange ceremonially burned the unsold copies and launched a boycott against the Harmsworth Press Prime Minister H H Asquith accused the paper of being disloyal to the country
